DataElement.preferredName: Edmonton Symptom Assessment System Current Assessment Not Tired to Worst Possible Tiredness Score 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of the severity of their energy lever being decreased (but not necessarily sleepy) between two extremes (none to worst possible) at the time of the assessment, using an eleven point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Edmonton Symptom Assessment System Current Assessment Not Tired To Worst Possible Tiredness Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care._Occurring in or belonging to the present time._Having determined the value, significance, or extent of._An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction._A question about whether an individual feels or felt tired._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A question about an individual's experience of tiredness at its worst._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care.

Concepts.definition: A self-report assessment tool to screen for the intensity of nine symptoms commonly experienced by cancer patients in palliative care.

Property.preferredName: Current Assessment Negation Felt Tired To Worst Possible Tiredness Score
Property.preferredDefinition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.:An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A question about whether a person is or has been tired.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:A question about an individual's experience of tiredness at its worst.:A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: Occurring in or belonging to the present time.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A question about whether an individual feels or felt tired.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A question about an individual's experience of tiredness at its worst.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Symptom Severity Range Integer::11 Point Scale
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.:Severity; used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather.:The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.:A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::11:The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.:an ordered reference standard.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.
Used of the degree of something undesirable e.g. pain or weather; also, strictness.
The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
The precise location of something; a spatially limited location.
An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
